  • Method Details

    • deleteClaimContacts

      public static void deleteClaimContacts(Location commitLocation, Claim claim, ClaimContact[] claimContactsToDelete, Map displayableErrorMap)
      Deletes the given set of ClaimContacts. If the entire set of ClaimContacts cannot be deleted, then the errors are reported in the given error map. Otherwise, the ClaimContacts are deleted. Changes are committed using the given location.

      This will normally be an allCheckedRowsAction for a CheckedValuesToolbarButton.

      For a simplified example, 

                     <CheckedValuesToolbarButton label="displaykey.Button.Delete" id="ClaimContacts_DeleteButton"
                                        hideIfEditable="true"
                                        iterator="PeopleInvolvedDetailedLV"
                                        allCheckedRowsAction="claimparties.ClaimContactUtil.deleteClaimContacts(CurrentLocation, Claim, CheckedValues, CheckedValuesErrors)"
                                        flags="any ClaimContact"
                                        visible="perm.Claim.managepartiesinvolved(claim)"
                                        shortcut="L"/>
      Parameters:
      commitLocation - the current/active location
      claim - the claim from which ClaimContacts should be deleted
      claimContactsToDelete - the set of ClaimContacts to delete
      displayableErrorMap - an empty Map in which user displayable errors can be stored

    • deleteNewClaimContacts

      public static void deleteNewClaimContacts(Location refreshLocation, Claim claim, ClaimContact[] claimContactsToDelete, Map displayableErrorMap)
      Deletes the given set of ClaimContacts in the NewClaimWizard. If the entire set of ClaimContacts cannot be deleted, then the errors are reported in the given error map.

      This will normally be an allCheckedRowsAction for a CheckedValuesToolbarButton.

      For a simplified example, 

         <CheckedValuesToolbarButton label="displaykey.Button.Delete" id="NewClaimWizard_PartiesInvolvedScreen_DeleteButton"
                               iterator="NewClaimPeopleInvolvedDetailedLV"
                               allCheckedRowsAction="claimparties.ClaimContactUtil.deleteNewClaimContacts(CurrentLocation, Claim, CheckedValues, CheckedValuesErrors)"
                               />
      Parameters:
      refreshLocation - the current/active location
      claim - the claim from which new ClaimContacts should be deleted
      claimContactsToDelete - the set of new ClaimContacts to delete
      displayableErrorMap - an empty Map in which user displayable errors can be stored

    • isBeingDeleted

      public static boolean isBeingDeleted(ClaimContact claimContact)
      Determines whether the given ClaimContact is being deleted. Used for disabling validation expressions that get run as part of committing a location when doing a ClaimContact delete.
      Parameters:
      claimContact - the ClaimContact to check.
      Returns:
      true if the ClaimContact is being deleted or has been removed from the current bundle, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • deleteClaimContacts(com.guidewire.pl.web.navigation.Location, entity.Claim, entity.ClaimContact[], java.util.Map)

    • transferClaimContacts

      public static void transferClaimContacts(Location location, ClaimContact[] sourceClaimContacts, ClaimContact targetClaimContact, Map displayableErrorMap)
      Transfers all roles from the given array of ClaimContacts to the target ClaimContact. If all of the roles cannot be transferred, errors are reported in the given error map. Changes are committed using the given location.
      Parameters:
      location - the current/active location
      sourceClaimContacts - the set of Claimcontacts to be merged from
      targetClaimContact - the ClaimContact into which to merge the selected Claimcontacts
      displayableErrorMap - an empty Map in which user displayable errors can be stored

    • createClaimContact

      public static ClaimContact createClaimContact(Claim claim, TemporaryContact tempContact)
      Add an existing Contact, picked from the Address Book, to Parties Involved.

      Use this method instead of claim.createClaimContact when dealing with a contact picked from the address book. Contacts picked from the address book are temporary and do not exist in the local database, so they need to be copied into a local bundle before they can be committed. This method copies the contact, plus any associated objects (e.g. addresses) into the claim's bundle and then calls claim.createClaimContact on the newly copied contact.

      Parameters:
      claim - the current/active Claim.
      tempContact - a TemporaryContact
      Returns:
      a ClaimContact

    • getLinkStatus

      public static ContactSystemLinkStatus getLinkStatus(TemporaryContact tempContact)
      Generate the link status for the contact
      Parameters:
      tempContact - The contact to calculate the link status for
      Returns:
      The current link status for the contact

    • updateNameDenormOnClaimContacts

      public static void updateNameDenormOnClaimContacts(String publicID, String origSubtype, String targetSubtype, String displayName)
      After contact subtype has been changed, the claim contact denorm fields needs to change accordingly to make searching possible. This is necessary when changing between Person invalid input: '<'-> Company/Place because Person uses FirstNameDenorm and LastNameDenorm while Company/Place uses NameDenorm
      Parameters:
      publicID - The PublicID of the ClaimContact associated with the subtype changed contact
      origSubtype - The original subtype of the contact
      targetSubtype - The new subtype of the contact
      displayName - The new denormed name for the contact
